Reviews.Title: “Depends on your expectations”
Reviews.Author: Matthew1234
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews and was worried about staying here but thought I'd give it a whirl after a booking elsewhere fell through at the last minute. I paid £26 for a single room, and as a regular budget hotel guest in London I know how cheap this is. My expectations were low... HOWEVER, I was pleasantly surprised. The staff were very friendly, and although my room wasn't in the Ivy House itself (it was in Cedar Lodge, a few doors further down) there were card locks on all the interior and exterior doors and CCTV - it was pretty secure. The decor is very basic and somewhat tired, but I can't criticise the cleanliness of my room, the bed linen, or the bathroom. I was particularly happy to be upgraded to a double en-suite at no extra cost. If you are traveling to London and expect to be getting the value for money as in other major cities then you need to readjust your expectations. You are paying pretty much the lowest price in London and consequently you shouldn't expect a spacious and charming hotel room. To put it in perspective, a bed in a YHA dormitory in London is about £20. What you should expect is somewhere that is functional and clean, which is what I got. Yes, the bathrooms are seriously tiny. Yes, the walls are paper-thin. Yes, the carpets are looking a little threadbare. However, if all you want is somewhere to watch a spot of TV and hit the hay then I don't think you could do better for the money. In conclusion, this is not somewhere I'll be staying with the wife for a romantic weekend break, but I'll certainly be booking it again when I want somewhere cheap to stay when I'm in town on my own. I didn't bother with the breakfast, so can't comment on it.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: Bongebon
Reviews.Content: Terrible place. We were taken down the road to an annex hotel ( if you can call it a hotel) and taken up 6 flights of very narrow stairs to a door - no landing - just a door that looked like it came from the hobbit as it was so small. Through the door was a loft room with a double bed and 2 singles....how the hell they got the beds in I will never know. The window was barred up like a prison cell with a nicotine stained curtain hanging off. The walls were black with damp. It smelt. Do you need to know any more??? We went straight back down stairs, back up the road to the ivy house and demanded our money back. We were ushered into a back room whilst a man tried to get my luggage off me saying he will put it somewhere safe for me.....I clung onto it!! It took about 30 mins of the man repeating " but what is the problem?" and me listing the endless problems...the main 2 were fire regs - how the hell anyone would get out of that room is beyond me. And the fact that it wasn't IN the hotel that I booked. He refunded me my £85 and that was that. THIS IS NOT A HOTEL!! Do not stay here save pay an extra £20 and stay else where.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: edoarda
Reviews.Content: Nice people at the reception. Great location. Very very small room, but fine bathroom and fine tv. Good breakfast. There's no better for the same price round the corner. The railway is quite close, but we couldn't hear any noise from it.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, good location”
Reviews.Author: Vickie1781
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very, very small and you can barely get into the combined toilet/shower as it is so slow. The only good thing about this place is the location

Reviews.Title: “It's the same as the Holly House hotel - equally vile”
Reviews.Author: Scribble_dog
Reviews.Content: I understand from other reviewers that there are about 4 hotels in Hugh St owned by the same people. I booked for Holly House, but was given a front door key that fitted a door marked Ivy House - they are actually the same concern but with two doors and two signs outside. It is the worst hotel I've ever been to and believe me, I've seen (and smelt) a few stinkers. Shabby, dirty, ugh, ugh, ugh! And I'm not even houseproud! I think the ads are completely dishonest, and the proprietors are just relying cynically on the fact that they are located close to Victoria. For more details see my review of Holly House on this site.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff Tried.....”
Reviews.Author: CMoney_Tbone
Reviews.Content: There really isn't much good to say here. Location? Par. Cleanliness? Sub Par. Breakfast? sub par. Let me elaborate. The bathroom was a scene from cabin fever. Poop, Shower, and Shave at the same time? Yes! But that wasn't the issue.... Picture this: Dripping shower head... No fan... Mold? yes! My boyfriend doesn't care about swampish bathrooms but he was bothered by the splashing at his ankles whilst relieving himself in the middle of the night. Did we talk to the sweet youngsters running the joint? Yes. Did they bleach away under the careful supervision of bf's mother? Yes. Did it solve the problem? No. Did we leave? No. Partly our fault. Fair enough... That being said the staff tried... and don't take a cab in london.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: gtosi
Reviews.Content: in one word we can say that this hotel is distusting: the rooms are 2meters for 3, you cannot move inside and there is neither place for your luggage, about the bathroom is better to not speak about and in general is very dirty..the only positive aspect is that is located in a very good position: 2 minutes from victoria station and 10 from the big ben

Reviews.Title: “Ivy house hotel”
Reviews.Author: KittyKat06
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend recently went on a trip to London and chose the Ivy house hotel to stay in as it was cheap and looked like a decent hotel on the website. When we got there we were discusted with what we were given and how they could even call it a room. It was a tiny boxed size room with a bunkbed and then a single bed, the sheets looked filthy and the carpet was discusting as soon as we entered the room there was this discusting smell and the bathroom (if you could call it that) smelt even worse. In the end we decided that we just couldn't stay there so made a complaint and finally got our money back and went and stayed at the Days inn hotel up the road. Dont ever stay at this hotel its just discusting and most definately the worst hotel I have ever been in.

Reviews.Title: “What did you expect?”
Reviews.Author: Christine-ESLJ
Reviews.Content: Like everyone has saidâ€¦ you get what you pay for. The hotel is cheap. Itâ€™s one tiny little step up from a hostel. Thereâ€™s no promise of great amenities or service. You basically get about 100 square feet of space (if that), a bed to sleep in, a toilet to take care of business on and a roof over your head. Thereâ€™s not even a tubâ€¦ just a shower head that sticks out of the wall (if youâ€™re lucky enough to book a room that has a private bathroom). Itâ€™s all about location for this hotel. Itâ€™s just a block and a half from Victoria Station. So itâ€™s perfect as a cheap place to rest your head in the center of London. I personally wouldnâ€™t stay for more than one night, because the bathroom is a bit scary, and I wouldnâ€™t pay more than 50 pounds for a room. But if you go in with realistic expectations, you wonâ€™t be disappointed, and youâ€™ll be in the center of London.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific!”
Reviews.Author: Savah09
Reviews.Content: Room still had previous guest's belongings in the room. They said they would clean it but all they did was take out the guests shoesand bags leaving the used sheets towel and soap. I walked around the corner and booked at the Comfort Inn instead. Do NOT book at the Ivy. The Holly House Hotl is the same hotel. Don't be taken in by the lownprice. Stay at a hostel for the same price but without the stained, moldy, and smelly bathroom and horrible room!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: anglophile73
Reviews.Content: I booked at this hotel (again before joining TripAdvisor and reading any reviews!) for one night. The pictures on the website look nothing like the actual hotel. I was looking for something cheap and I found it in all respects. I paid 29 pounds for a single en suite. When I arrived I paid at the security window (no lobby) and got a room in the basement across from the dining room. Instead of one single bed there were actually two, along with a teeny tiny bathroom (smallest I've ever seen), a television and a mini fridge. The beds and towels appeared to be clean but the floor was pretty filthy and there were air fresheners dotting the room. I noticed right away that there was an apparatus on the wall that beeped every few minutes. I went back upstairs and got a gentleman to come check and it turned out to be a carbon monoxide detector with failing batteries. Instead of replacing the batteries, he just removed the detector from the room. I was traveling solo and the lock on the door appeared flimsy so I pulled the second bed in front of the door that night. Despite its small size the shower was strong and hot. Breakfast was simple, cornflakes and toast. There was no hairdryer available. Employees unfriendly and unhelpful. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: bumbling
Reviews.Content: Well I couldnt even bear to stay there so I lost Â£80. Booked for 2 nights and I stupidly paid on arrival as I was asked. The carpet was filthy, the bathroom was a cupboard and when I moved the bed away from the wall the skirting board was caked in what looked like sick!! No way could I sleep, shower or eat there!!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!”
Reviews.Author: catalan_traveler
Reviews.Content: Whatever you do, do not stay here. The hotel's website completely misrepresents the rooms. When you walk in, the lobby has a security window and they make you pay right away. Walking up to the rooms is scary, but not as bad as the rooms themselves. HORRIBLE. Dirty rooms with carpets and bedsheets that haven't been washed in years. A terrible sense of unsafety. The staff are horrible, and hotel management are, conveniently, never there. Trust me, do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “what a horror!!!”
Reviews.Author: Karin1
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, the receptionist looked at our booking confirmation and sayd "oh, you have a basic double room you can upgrade your room for GBP 10 per night (is Euro 15 per night)" Luckily we were already warned for these procedure, so we had asked our agent for a email, stating that we booked a room with private bathroom. OK he said, you get a beautiful room in the Ivy Guest house, because the Annexe hotel has no private bathrooms (huh???!!!!, I thought that was exactly what I had booked.....) So we went to our room, well you could better say we went to our closet. Immediately after I saw the room, I understood why we had to pay for the 2 nights in advance, before we could see the room. The bed was 120cm by 190 or 200cm. There was an airconditioning, but this was only giving hot air, because it was so dirty with dust and so was the fan. The carpet had not been cleaned for I guess 3 years. The bathroom was 5 feet (my lady feet....) square. The shower compartment in there was 2 feet x 3 feet. Because it was so tiny, the whole bathroom became wet after 1 person had a shower . The room was VERY hot. Ofcourse London was hot too this July, but this was not normal. The location is perfect - right at Victoria station, but we had a room at the back, so we could almost touch the trains from our window. They ran till 1.30 or 2 at night, and started at 4.50hrs again. As you can understand, together with the heat, we did not sleep very well. The breakfast was OK: cornflakes with milk, toast, jams marmelade and butter. We paid Euro 73.- per night, but if you ask me what the room was worth, I would say not more than Euro 15 per night. If we had not paid in advance, (no refund....) we would have gone to another hotel. Now we said to each other This is only for 2 nights. keep on smiling.....

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel ever!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JOANNEDORREE
Reviews.Content: I would honestly say this was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. We arrived and our room wasn't clean the cleaner was still in there picking up all the beer cans littering the floor. The room was so small with 2 single beds crammed in and a bathroom that was a practically a cupboard built in the corner of the room which was disgusting. The shower if you can call it that was just a shower head with no shower tray or anything with a grid on the floor for drainage. We felt cleaner not bothering having a shower god only know what you would have contracted! Our room was at the back of the hotel facing on to Victoria train station so if you are looking for a peaceful nights sleep you aren't going to get it all you hear is the squeeking of the trains grinding to a halt and the windows shaking in there frames. JUST DON'T GO TO THIS HOTEL!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Business_UK
Reviews.Content: Bedroom was dusty, window was broken, draught coming in from somewhere around the window frame, empty air freshener dispensers dotted around room and bathroom. Bathroom was appalling - extremely tiny and very difficult to use for showering or using the toilet. Everything looked like someone with zero DIY skills had had a go at making and fixing the fixtures and fittings. The breakfast must have been prepared on the lowest budget possible. It was so dreadful that I checked out after one night although I had prepaid for two nights and could not get a refund.

Reviews.Title: “not so nice for the price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went there last week end ( 6&7 november 2004). we were 4, and had book a month before 2 double rooms at the "Annexe Hotel". Once there the guy told us he had a problem and that he only got 1 family room at the Ivy Hotel, which is just near the Annexe hotel, in the same street. We had no choice, so we first visit it...it was not really nice, the bathroom was very small, only toilets and a kind of shower. Beds were ok, but it was written on it, great... and the wallpapers were awfull, 4 differents wallpapers for the same room. It was clean enough, but for the price it's not what I was expected to get. And the guy did not want to make us a price...I mean we were suposed to get 2 rooms... The breakfast was ok, toasts, jam, butter, cereals,coffee, tea, orange juice, but the kitchen room is very small, so you have to get up early to get a place before it's full.
